intro: Hetaeria ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf hetaeria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both horticulture and botany.
